CompetitionExecution

Class Localization

  • java.lang.Object
    • CompetitionExecution.Localization

  • public class Localization
extends java.lang.Object
    identifies (0,0) on grid and centralizes robot at this point
    Author:
    courtneywright

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private static int convertAngle(double radius, double width, double angle)
      methods originally from SquareDriver class in Lab2
      private static int convertDistance(double radius, double distance) 
      void localize()
      determine where the theta=0 is for robot placed anywhere within the starting square by checking the angles the robot much turn for the US sensor to be within the threshold distance from each of the walls
      void zeroRobot()
      determine where the zero-zero point on the floor grid is by getting angles between the first and third and second and fourth grid lines the light sensor detects and moves robot to this location to manually set odometer to 0-0-0.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Localization

        public Localization(Odometer odo,
            USPoller rightUS,
            USPoller leftUS,
            USPoller frontUS,
            LightPoller lightSensor,
            EV3LargeRegulatedMotor leftMotor,
            EV3LargeRegulatedMotor rightMotor,
            Navigation navigator)
        constructor for Localizer that can do both light and ultrasonic sensor parts of localization, each having its own associated methods
        Parameters:
        odo - same odometer to be used for determining position in localize() and zeroRobot() methods
        rightUS - right sensor used to localize robot in falling edge style
        leftUS - left sensor used to localize robot in falling edge style
        frontUS - front sensor used to check if robot is facing wall
        lightSensor - used to zero robot on line intersection using light sensor
        leftMotor - left motor used to physically move robot
        rightMotor - right motor used to physically move robot
        navigator - same navigator to be used for moving robot in localize() and zeroRobot() methods

    • Method Detail

      • localize

        public void localize()
        determine where the theta=0 is for robot placed anywhere within the starting square by checking the angles the robot much turn for the US sensor to be within the threshold distance from each of the walls

      • zeroRobot

        public void zeroRobot()
        determine where the zero-zero point on the floor grid is by getting angles between the first and third and second and fourth grid lines the light sensor detects and moves robot to this location to manually set odometer to 0-0-0.
